001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.jansi;
002
003import org.fusesource.jansi.AnsiConsole;
004import org.fusesource.jansi.AnsiMode;
005
006import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
007import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder;
008import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogOutput.OutputType;
009import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
010import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperty.Property;
011import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider;
012import io.jstach.svc.ServiceProvider;
013
014/**
015 * JAnsi Configurator which will install JAnsi. JAnsi will strip ANSI escape characters if
016 * piped out to a terminal (console) that does not support ANSI escape sequences.
017 */
018@ServiceProvider(RainbowGumServiceProvider.class)
019public class JAnsiConfigurator implements RainbowGumServiceProvider.Configurator {
020
021        /**
022         * Jansi disable property.
023         */
024        public static final String JANSI_DISABLE = LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX + "jansi.disable";
025
026        /**
027         * No Arg for service loader.
028         */
029        public JAnsiConfigurator() {
030        }
031
032        @Override
033        public boolean configure(LogConfig config) {
034                boolean globalDisable = isGlobalAnsiDisabled(config);
035                if (!globalDisable && installJansi(config)) {
036                        AnsiConsole.systemInstall();
037                        installJansiLogFormatter(config, AnsiConsole.out().getMode() == AnsiMode.Strip);
038                }
039                else {
040                        installJansiLogFormatter(config, globalDisable);
041                }
042                return true;
043        }
044
045        void installJansiLogFormatter(LogConfig config, boolean disableAnsi) {
046                config.encoderRegistry()
047                        .setEncoderForOutputType(OutputType.CONSOLE_OUT,
048                                        () -> LogEncoder.of(JansiLogFormatter.builder().disableAnsi(disableAnsi).build()));
049        }
050
051        boolean installJansi(LogConfig config) {
052                /*
053                 * Surefire seems to hate JANSI probably because maven uses. Regardless maven
054                 * tests probably do not need ansi output anyway.
055                 */
056                if (!System.getProperty("surefire.real.class.path", "").isEmpty()) {
057                        return false;
058                }
059                var disableProperty = Boolean.parseBoolean(config.properties().valueOrNull(JANSI_DISABLE));
060                if (disableProperty) {
061                        return false;
062                }
063                return true;
064        }
065
066        private boolean isGlobalAnsiDisabled(LogConfig config) {
067                boolean globalDisable = Property.builder() //
068                        .toBoolean() //
069                        .orElse(false) //
070                        .build(LogProperties.GLOBAL_ANSI_DISABLE_PROPERTY) //
071                        .get(config.properties())
072                        .value();
073                return globalDisable;
074        }
075
076}
